sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"捆，包"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: pack, package, packet, parcel, bunch, bundle
means: pack ： 指专为背负而包扎的包裹，也指驮物等。
package ： 指包装整齐严密的包裹或一包、一捆、一盒东西。
packet ： 一般指小件行李、邮包、还可指更小一些的包。
parcel ： 着重指邮包，也指将东西扎成小包或不太大的包。
bunch ： 指有规则地把同类东西固定在一起。
bundle ： 指多件东西被捆扎在一起。

word_mean: 包裹法：将病人包在毛毯或被单内，或将一个肢体缠上毛巾(可为湿的或干的，凉的或热的)，以治疗疾病
包裹物：用于包裹的毛毯、被单或毛巾

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German pak (noun), pakken (verb). The verb appears early in Anglo-Latin and Anglo-Norman French in connection with the wool trade; trade in English wool was chiefly with the Low Countries

early 16th cent. (in the sense 'enter into a private agreement'): probably from the obsolete verb pact 'enter into an agreement with', the final -t being interpreted as an inflection of the past tense

entry.def: When you pack a bag, you put clothes and other things into it, because you are leaving a place or going on holiday.

example.ex: When I was 17, I packed my bags and left home...
example.tran: 17岁时，我背起行囊离开了家。

example.ex: I decided to pack a few things and take the kids to my Mum's...
example.tran: 我决定收拾些东西，带孩子们去我妈妈家。

entry.def: When people pack things, for example in a factory, they put them into containers or parcels so that they can be transported and sold.

example.ex: They offered me a job packing goods in a warehouse...
example.tran: 他们给了我一份在货栈打包的工作。

example.ex: Machines now exist to pack olives in jars.
example.tran: 现在可用机器将橄榄装进罐子里。

entry.def: If people or things pack into a place or if they pack a place, there are so many of them that the place is full.

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people packed into the mosque...
example.tran: 几十万人挤进了那座清真寺。

example.ex: Seventy thousand people will pack the stadium.
example.tran: 将有7万人挤满整个体育场。

entry.def: A pack of things is a collection of them that is sold or given together in a box or bag.

example.ex: The club will send a free information pack.
example.tran: 这家俱乐部会邮寄一个免费资料包。

example.ex: ...a pack of cigarettes...
example.tran: 一包烟

entry.def: A pack is a bag containing your possessions that you carry on your back when you are travelling.

example.ex: I hid the money in my pack.
example.tran: 我把钱藏在旅行包里。

entry.def: You can refer to a group of people who go around together as a pack, especially when it is a large group that you feel threatened by.

example.ex: ...a pack of journalists eager to question him...
example.tran: 一群急着要问他问题的记者

example.ex: Sal was the leader of the pack.
example.tran: 萨尔是这伙人的头儿。

entry.def: A pack of wolves or dogs is a group of them that hunt together.
A pack of playing cards is a complete set of playing cards.

example.ex: ...a pack of cards.
example.tran: 一副纸牌

example.ex: ...shuffle the pack.
example.tran: 洗牌

entry.def: If someone packs a gun, they carry it.

example.ex: ...eight bodyguards, at least one of them packing a pistol.
example.tran: 8名保镖，其中至少有1人佩枪

entry.tran: 在（陪审团、委员会、会议等）中安插支持者
entry.def: If someone packs a jury, committee, or meeting, they make sure that it includes people who support them.

example.ex: Opposition parties have boycotted the proceedings, saying the government has packed the conference with its own supporters...
example.tran: 反对党派抵制了该议程，声称政府在大会上安插了亲信。

example.ex: John Major will not try to pack the House of Lords.
example.tran: 约翰·梅杰不会在上议院安插亲信。

entry.def: If you say that an account is a pack of lies, you mean that it is completely untrue.

example.ex: You told me a pack of lies.
example.tran: 你跟我说的都是一派胡言。

entry.def: If something packs a punch, it has a very powerful effect.

example.ex: W. Somerset Maugham's novel still packs an emotional punch.
example.tran: 威廉·萨默塞特·毛姆的小说仍具有强烈的情感冲击力。

example.ex: ...drinks that pack a punch.
example.tran: 烈酒

entry.def: If you send someone packing,  you make them go away.

example.ex: I decided I wanted to live alone and I sent him packing.
example.tran: 我决定要一个人生活，于是叫他走人。

entry.def: You can say that someone is ahead of the pack or leading the pack if they are ahead of everyone else in a race or competition.

example.ex: The Socialists may still finish ahead of the pack...
example.tran: 社会党最终仍可能会领先。

example.ex: Europe has got used to following rather than leading the pack.
example.tran: 欧洲已经习惯了跟从，而不是领头儿。

sentences.sentence: "She packs a gun when she goes into the mountains"

"tamp the coffee grinds in the container to make espresso"

means.word_mean: 11. have the property of being packable or compactable or of compacting easily;

sentences.sentence: "Such odd-shaped items do not pack well"

means.word_mean: 13. treat the body or any part of it by wrapping it, as with blankets or sheets, and applying compresses to it, or stuffing it to provide cover, containment, or therapy, or to absorb blood;

sentences.sentence: "The nurse packed gauze in the wound"
"You had better pack your swollen ankle with ice"

Sentence.sentence: Likewise, a married man who smokes more than a pack a day is likely to live as long as a divorced man who doesn't smoke.
Packing up again with no picnic, Zac had to switch schools for the second time and space is even tighter

sentences.en: His pack was undone.
sentences.cn: 他的背包打开了。

sentences.en: The climber carried some food in a pack on his back.
sentences.cn: 那名登山者背着一袋食品。

sentences.en: This pack of clothes is mine.
sentences.cn: 这包衣服是我的。

sentences.en: A pack of cigarettes lasts him two days.
sentences.cn: 一包香烟够他抽两天的。

sentences.en: The boy bought three packs of gum.
sentences.cn: 那男孩买了三小盒口香糖。

means.word_mean: 一群; 一伙; 一堆

sentences.en: The pack of hounds was baying loudly.
sentences.cn: 那群猎狗在大声吠叫着。

sentences.en: He has faced a pack of troubles since the end of the war.
sentences.cn: 自从战争结束以来, 他已遇到一大堆麻烦。

sentences.en: He dealt the pack.
sentences.cn: 他发牌。

sentences.en: I'm leaving in an hour and I haven't packed yet!
sentences.cn: 我一小时之后就要走了, 可行李还没有收拾好哩！

sentences.en: This dress packs beautifully.
sentences.cn: 这件连衣裙包装得很漂亮。

sentences.en: Pack your things at once.
sentences.cn: 马上把你的东西收拾好。

sentences.en: Please pack the food for me.
sentences.cn: 请为我把这些食品打包。

sentences.en: Have you packed me a razor?
sentences.cn: 你替我把剃须刀装进包里了吗?

sentences.en: About two thousand people packed the hall.
sentences.cn: 约有两千人把礼堂挤得满满的。

sentences.en: The snow had packed against the wall.
sentences.cn: 墙根的雪形成了雪团。

sentences.en: The wind packed the snow against the wall.
sentences.cn: 风把雪吹到墙边堆积起来。

sentences.en: She packed her husband some bread and cheese for his lunch.
sentences.cn: 她为丈夫备好面包和乳酪作为午餐。

sentences.en: They knew all along that he was packing a gun.
sentences.cn: 他们向来都知道他身上带着枪。

sentences.en: The trucks packed the snow on the road.
sentences.cn: 卡车把马路上的雪压的很结实。

sentences.en: We are busy packing for a journey.
sentences.cn: 我们忙于整理去旅游的行装。

sentences.en: Round things won't pack easily
sentences.cn: 圆形物不易包装。

sentences.en: Some twenty people were packed in this small room.
sentences.cn: 大约有20个人挤在这间小屋里。

jushi.english: They watched little packs of tanks approach their position.
jushi.chinese: 他们看着一小队坦克向其阵地迫近。

jushi.english: They're like a pack of kids!
